intro: Centaurium madrense, commonly known as the Madreño centaury, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to violet. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has narrow, grass-like leaves. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Centaurium madrense is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to arid environments.
